headline: Trade deals are key to halting US tech decline, Wedbush’s Ives says
summary: Investing.com -- Wedbush tech analyst Dan Ives highlighted the urgent need for trade deals to address the challenges facing the US technology sector amid ongoing tariff disputes. The analysts pointed out the significant uncertainty and potential damage to the US and global economies, particularly the US tech industry, which has been thrust into the eye of the storm.

headline: Cloud AI Update - Tonita Unveils AI Shopping Assistant Transforming E-Commerce Experience
summary: Tonita has launched a new AI-driven shopping assistant that aims to revolutionize the e-commerce experience by allowing users to browse and purchase clothing more intuitively. This AI platform enables conversational searching, offering real-time, personalized product recommendations by interpreting natural language queries. Unlike traditional e-commerce sites, Tonita integrates live product listings from various retailers, providing users with a streamlined shopping process and smart alerts...

headline: How to trade the Magnificent 7 amid the market sell-off
summary: As US stocks (^DJI, ^GSPC, ^IXIC) sell off, Solidarity Capital CEO Jeff McClean sits down with Josh Lipton to check in on the "Magnificent Seven," made up of Nvidia (NVDA), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Tesla (TSLA), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Meta (META), and Apple (AAPL). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

headline: 22% of Warren Buffett-Led Berkshire Hathaway's $265 Billion Portfolio Is Invested in Only 1 Stock
summary: Warren Buffett has been at the helm of Berkshire Hathaway for decades.  The best investment decision made by the "Oracle of Omaha," at least based on the dollar figure of gains it has achieved, may have happened in the past decade.  Shares of this dominant business are up 649% since the start of 2016, the year Buffett first started buying.

headline: Warren Buffett Timed His Apple Stock Sale to Perfection. What’s Next?
summary: When  Warren Buffett  hosts “Woodstock for Capitalists” 11 days from now, he’ll have replaced one pesky question with another.  Berkshire Hathaway  is sitting on more cash than any company in history, including its own, at about $318 billion.  Much of it piled up the old-fashioned way, in a steady stream from the conglomerate’s subsidiaries and investments.

headline: Despite Cutting Apple's Price Target, Wedbush's Dan Ives Remains Bullish on the Stock for the Long Term. Should You?
summary: Investors may not know what to make of Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) stock.  This is not the case with Wedbush's Dan Ives, who continues to hold to a long-term bullish call on Apple stock.  Ives seems to base his case for Apple stock primarily on the success of the iPhone.

headline: Trump's Tariffs Continue to Affect Apple. Should Investors Sell the Stock?
summary: President Trump's economic policies are causing significant volatility in the stock market.  On April 3, he announced his administration would impose expansive tariffs on most countries.  Then, about a week later, he decided to pause this plan for 90 days for most countries -- except China, for which he increased the previously announced tariffs.

raw.headline: Trump's Tariffs Continue to Affect Apple. Should Investors Sell the Stock?
